credits.title: SteamHub Credits & Contributors
credits.developers: SteamHub is designed, developed, and moderated by the staff of the SteamHub Foundation, a nonprofit organization.
credits.moderators: The team of SteamHub moderators manages, supports, and improves the SteamHub online community:
credits.previousBody: Many important contributions have been made by previous SteamHub Team members, including John Maloney (who led software development for the first decade of SteamHub) and Andrés Monroy-Hernández (who led the development of the first SteamHub community website). Other contributors include:
credits.researchersIntro: Research on SteamHub is being conducted by members of the MIT SteamHub Team and researchers at other universities, including:
credits.partnersBody: Paula Bontá and Brian Silverman, Playful Invention Company (who started contributing to the design of SteamHub even before it was called SteamHub).
credits.researchersBody: {scratchResearchLink} is being conducted by members of the MIT SteamHub Team and researchers at other universities, including:
credits.researchersContributors: Yasmin Kafai (who collaborated on the {nsfLink}) at the University of Pennsylvania Graduate School of Education, Karen Brennan (who leads the {SteamHub}) at the Harvard Graduate School of Education, Benjamin Mako Hill at the University of Washington, Andrés Monroy Hernández at Microsoft Research, Mimi Ito and Crystle Martin at the University of California, Irvine, Quinn Burke at College of Charleston, Deborah Fields at Utah State University, and Kylie Peppler at Indiana University.
credits.acknowledgementsContributors: The following people have also contributed to the development and support of SteamHub over the years:
credits.acknowledgementsDonors: The SteamHub Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit that relies on tax-deductible donations to support SteamHub and keep it free for all. For a list of donors to the SteamHub Foundation, please visit the {donorsLink}.
credits.acknowledgementsLifelongKinderga: The {lifelongKindergartenLink} at the MIT Media Lab initiated the SteamHub project in 2002, and received a {nsfGrantLink} to support it a year later. The group publicly launched SteamHub in 2007 and developed it through 2019, when the SteamHub Team moved to the SteamHub Foundation. The Lifelong Kindergarten group, led by Professor Mitchel Resnick, continues to collaborate with the SteamHub Team to research and support creative learning with SteamHub around the world.
credits.acknowledgementsTranslators: With the help of {translatorsLink} around the world, SteamHub is available in many languages.
credits.acknowledgementsLanguageOrganize: Many thanks to the following language organizers for helping to coordinate SteamHub translators in their language:
credits.acknowledgementsCommunity: We greatly appreciate all of the contributions by members of the worldwide SteamHub community, who have shaped the direction of SteamHub by sharing their projects, comments, and ideas.
credits.acknowledgementsInfluencers: The ideas of Seymour Papert and Alan Kay have deeply inspired and influenced our work on SteamHub.
credits.supportersFinancialHeader: The following organizations have provided major financial support for SteamHub:
credits.supportersServicesHeader: The following organizations donate their services to help keep the SteamHub project running:
credits.supportersOpenHeader: SteamHub would not be possible without free and open source software, including:
credits.currentFinancialSupport: The following organizations are providing major financial support for SteamHub:
credits.acknowledgementsIllustrations: Many thanks to the following artists for their contributions to the SteamHub sprite library:
credits.pastContributorsThanks: Many important contributions have been made by previous SteamHub Team members, including:
credits.acknowledgementsSounds: The SteamHub sound library uses free sound resources from Adobe.com, Archive.org, FreeMusicArchive.org, FreeSound.org, and Incompetech.com.
credits.soundsThanks: Thanks to Nina Paley from Archive.org; Kellee Maize, Peter Rudenko, and Chris Zabriskie from FreeMusicArchive.org; and Kevin MacLeod from Incompetech.com. Thanks to the following freesound.org artists:
